object.name: making_a_proposal_content_type
object.property: Dexterity web page with instructions for making a proposal content type.

<model xmlns:security="http://namespaces.plone.org/supermodel/security" xmlns:marshal="http://namespaces.plone.org/supermodel/marshal" xmlns:form="http://namespaces.plone.org/supermodel/form" xmlns="http://namespaces.plone.org/supermodel/schema">
    <schema>
      <field name="content" type="plone.app.textfield.RichText">
        <default><ol>
  <li>Log in as a full Manager otherwise you cannot create Dexterity content types on a standard Plone site.  It is possible to allow the Site Administrator access to Dexterity, but this should only be done after careful thought about who will get "site administrator" permissions.</li>
  <li>Navigate to the "Site Setup" page.  This is usually accessible from the user menu in the upper right, but will depend upon how your site is themed.</li>
  <li>Click on the "Dexterity Content Types" link.</li>
  <li>Find the "mock_proposal" type on the list and check it.  Scroll to the bottom of the page and click on "Clone".  Give your clone a name.  When you click in the "short_name" box plone will pick a short name which is used to access the type from code and using web calls.  If you do not like the automatic choice you can change it, but must keep it one word.  When done save.  Your cloned type will now appear in the list.</li>
  <li>Edit the contents (fields) to be what you want.  If you are trying to maintain author/proposer anonymity during the review process, do not include fields that could be used to identify the author.  To activate editing of the fields in your type click on the type title in the list.</li>
  <li>Navigate to the "Types" page from the "Site Setup" page.  In the top pop-up menu select your new type.  In the "New Workflow" pop-up menu select "Proposal Workflow".  This will bring up a list of states.  You can ignore this since your type is new.  Save.  Now any of your content items of this type will follow the "Proposal Workflow".</li>
  <li>Limit inside of which content types this information can be put.  You may have multiple kinds of proposal drop boxes (content types) on your site, you can make sure that this type can only be added to the appropriate drop box.  </li>
  <ol class="listTypeLowerAlpha">
  <li>Navigate to the "Zope Management Interface" (ZMI) for the "Site Setup" page.</li>
  <li>In the long list of links you will find a "portal_types" link.  Click on this.</li>
  <li>Find the link for the type of content item you want to which you want this to be added.  Click on this link.</li>
  <li>On the page displayed you will see two check boxes "Implicitly addable?" and "Filter content types?".  Make sure both are checked.</li>
  <li>In the scrolling list below these select your new content type and any others that you want to be available to add inside the drop box.</li>
  <li>Scroll down and click on the "Save Changes" button.</li>
  </ol>
  <li>You need to make sure that the add link on your web site will actually add your new content type and not the one you cloned.  Some versions of Dexterity do not change the link when you clone.</li>
  <ol>
  <li>Still within the "portal_types" page of the ZMI navigate to the page for the new type you just made.</li>
  <li>If the string after the "add++" in the "Add view URL (Expression)" field does not exactly match the string in the "Product factory" field replace the string after the "add++" with the contents of the "Product factory" field.</li>
  <li>Scroll down and click on the "Save Changes" button.</li>
  </ol></ol>
  <p>The new content type should now be addable inside of your chosen proposal drop box type.</p></default>
        <description>Put your Rich Text content here.</description>
        <title>----</title>
      </field>
    </schema>
  </model>
